Despite Pakistan's team collapse and loss, Farhan was felicitated for these theatrics. Critics argue such personal flair overshadows sportsmanship and true cricketing achievement, a trend reinforced by his new sticker.

title: Shakti intensifies into ‘severe’ storm, says IMD; rough sea, strong winds likely along Gujarat-Maharashtra coast
Cough syrup row: Tests confirm presence of poisonous chemical; MP bans sale of 'Coldrif'
description: Seven children in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district died from consuming Coldrif cough syrup, confirmed to contain the toxic industrial chemical diethylene glycol (DEG). Following Tamil Nadu lab test results, the Madhya Pradesh government banned Coldrif and all products by Sresan Pharmaceuticals, ordering immediate statewide seizure of stocks.

Key provisions cover education, health, and electricity improvements. Administrative reforms and infrastructure projects are also part of the agreement.

description: A US-based company recently laid off its Indian workforce in just four minutes during a virtual meeting, leaving employees shocked and unprepared. The focus is on the human side of sudden layoffs and eight practical coping strategies including financial planning, career rebuilding, and mental well-being to help professionals manage unexpected job loss.

title: Trump's Gaza plan: Israel prepares for '1st stage'; what is the 20-point proposal?
description: Hamas partially accepted President Trump's peace plan for Gaza, expressing readiness for immediate talks on hostage release and ending the conflict. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu also prepared to implement the plan's first stage. The proposal outlines a deradicalized Gaza, technocratic governance, and a pathway to Palestinian self-determination, with Trump overseeing redevelopment efforts.

They pleaded guilty to assaulting and robbing two women in hotel rooms after being approached by a man offering sex workers. The men cited financial hardship as their motive for the crimes.

The outcome could reshape immigration policy and global talent flow.

Kidney transplant breakthrough: Scientists create universal donor kidney
description: Scientists converted a type A kidney into a type O universal donor kidney. Enzymes removed specific antigens from the organ. The converted kidney worked normally for two days in a brain-dead patient. Antigens then reappeared. This research shows a path to reduce kidney transplant waiting times. It could benefit many type O patients.

U'khand: 22-yr-old merchant navy’s senior deck cadet goes missing at sea; search ops on
description: A 22-year-old senior deck cadet, Karandeep Singh Rana, went missing from a merchant navy vessel. The ship was traveling from Iraq to China via Sri Lanka and Singapore. His family last contacted him on September 20. The shipping company confirmed his disappearance overboard. A 96-hour search operation was conducted. The vessel is now heading to China for a full investigation.

‘Op Gaanjaney’: How ATS tracked ex-NSG commando in 200kg drug bust; kingpin had political ambitions
description: Rajasthan ATS apprehended former NSG commando Bajrang Singh, wanted in a 200kg ganja smuggling case. Singh, who served in the 26/11 Mumbai operation and retired in 2021, became a narcotics kingpin, leveraging local connections after failed political ambitions. He was tracked for two months using technical intelligence and informers, culminating in his arrest under 'Operation Gaanjaney'.

title: Arthur Jones cause of death: How did the Ravens’ Super Bowl champion die at 39
description: Former NFL star and Super Bowl champion Arthur Jones died suddenly at 39, with his cause of death unconfirmed. A key defensive player in the Baltimore Ravens' Super Bowl XLVII victory, his passing deeply saddened the sports world. Jones, from a renowned athletic family, is remembered for his positive spirit and legacy.

title: 'Why would he visit at night?': Dalit man wanting to go to temple assaulted; FIR filed
description: A Dalit labourer was allegedly assaulted and threatened in Himatnagar after expressing a wish to visit a temple. Upon showing his Aadhaar card, an accused subjected him to casteist slurs and physical abuse, questioning his presence as a Dalit. He was later driven away and warned against returning, prompting an FIR under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

title: Meerut: Cloth trader shot dead by friends; accused uploads video online
description: Meerut: A 25-year-old man was allegedly shot dead by his friends in a forested area, with the gruesome act recorded and circulated online. Police suspect Mohd Adil was lured and killed over suspicions of betraying rivals in a previous murder.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
description: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
description: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: Rarest of rare: 'Foetus-in-foetus’ baby delivered at Karnataka hospital
description: Karnataka Medical College and Research Institute successfully delivered a baby with a rare "foetus-to-foetus" condition on September 23. An inner, undeveloped foetus, described as a parasitic twin with rudimentary spine and skull, was found within the newborn. Both mother and baby are stable. Doctors deem this a "rarest of the rare" case, planning further tests and documentation for medical journals.

title: 'Demanding Rs 30k maintenance on Rs 12k salary': Man brutally beaten by in-laws
description: Kunal, who married against his in-laws' wishes, was brutally assaulted in Sonipat by his wife's father, uncle, and associates. His arms and legs were broken after he posted marriage photos online, which angered the family who had allegedly arranged her second marriage. Police registered an FIR, and Kunal is undergoing treatment.

title: Stephen A. Smith on Shedeur Sanders’ 'silence' amid Browns QB drama
description: Shedeur Sanders made headlines in Cleveland on October 1, 2025. He remained silent during a press conference. Stephen A. Smith defended his actions, calling judgment unfair. Cam Newton discussed Sanders' brand value for the Browns. Both analysts agreed his true test would come only when he steps onto the field.
